newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - BTPs eye 137.05, but cracks appear.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - BTPs eye 137.05, but cracks appear.

text.p: Italian BTP futures traded on LIFFE appeared to be running out of steam on Friday, after the previous session saw a decline for the first time this month, traders in London said.
On Thursday, the September contract closed at 136.24, after opening at 136.40.
"Momentum is slowing, short stochastics started turning in the last day or so," said Marc Ostwald, technical analyst at London Bond Broking Company. "It's a violently overbought market."
September BTPs were up 0.23 at 136.47 by 0750 GMT.
BTPs were heading for resistance from the contract high at 137.05 set on July 9, after overcoming initial resistance from a pivot point at 136.40 in early trade.

Technical analysts at an Italian bank also said further retracement could be on the cards, as the contract opened below an upsloping trend line at 136.35/40. However, they said the bear market was likely to be short-term.
"The major trend is positive, buy dips," the Italian bank analysts said in a research note.
They cited resistance at 136.85, and a defeat of the contract high at 137.05 would target 137.85.
On the downside, support was pegged at 135.98/95, lows set on July 8 and July 10.
"If it falls off more, then the 135.33/35 lows will be the next support," said Ostwald.
At the short end, September Eurolira futures were unchanged at 93.31. Supports were at 93.29/28 and then 93.21/20. Resistances were at 93.35 and 93.45.
